NUsa Dua Beach - Second Review

I first reviewed Nusa Dua beach in 2018 and commented that in late November/December the water was absolutely full of rubbish and gave it only 3 stars because of that. I want to give credit where its due and say that 12 months later it was absolutely stunning and not a single bit of rubbish could be seen. The water was warm and crystal clear, the sand well kept and plenty of time has been spent making the place look great.WI was told by a few people that the rubbish situation is seasonal as particular currents and water flows bring the rubbish into the area but that its soon flushed out. Based on my two visits (so far) that seems to be the case.So its only fair that I mention that in September 2019 it was fantastic and postcard perfect. We all enjoyed going for walks from the Novotels 2.28 Beach Club up to the Waterblow. Lots of great little bars and places to eat you can just stop in by the way and plenty of squirrels everywhere for people to feed ;)Hope its the same this later this year when we return - easily one of the best beaches in Bali, much better than the tourist traps over in Kuta/Legian. A pandemic pleasant surprise

It's been already almost two years that I my travelling activities have been put to a brutal stop because of the pandemic. I have been enjoying an almost monastic life in Bali since, staying on the island and reducing all visits and outings to a strict minimum, most of the places being closed or running at very slow pace anyway. Imagine my surprise then, when I recently went to the Museum Pasifika and realized how pleasant that experience was. The place undergoing now some renovations, going through the spacy exhibition rooms made me feel like an art student dicovering the graal. New paintings on the walls, new displays, a beautiful Raden Saleh popping out of a red wall, beautiful series of Le Mayeur and Theo Meier paintings. Just beautiful. And quiet.
